thread.section_title: DC Inno | Washington DC Tech, City and Political News
thread.title: DC Inno Approved: Tech Events to Know About This Week
thread.title_full: DC Inno Approved: Tech Events to Know About This Week

author: Chris Bing
title: DC Inno Approved: Tech Events to Know About This Week
text:
share Credit: Flickr 
Here's what we've found for the best startup and tech networking events in the D.C. area to check out this week. Keep an eye out for the highlighted event , which is a sure bet for a great time. Monday, October 5 
Location: 12930 Worldgate Drive, Suite 120, Herndon, V.A. Date/Time: Monday, October 5, 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. Price: Free 
Learn about how edtech giant Blackboard has used OpenStack to develop a leading local business that connects millions with online education resources. The focus of the discussion will concern deployment and architecture for building private OpenStack cloud products. 
Location: iStrategy Labs, 641 S St NW, First Floor, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Monday, October 5, 6:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. Price: Free 
Are you a local female entrepreneur that has wanted to learn to code but don’t know where to get started? If so, this front end hack night, hosted at ISL’s awesome office space, is perfect for you. Guests will be introduced to beginner techniques, skills and the larger scape of what's possible when coding on the front end. Tuesday, October 6 
Location: Crystal City Marriott, 1999 Jefferson Davis Highway, Arlington, V.A. Date/Time: Tuesday, October 6, 6 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. Price: Free 
In the backdrop of Fort Meade and the Pentagon, the DMV is undoubtedly home to some impressive cybersecurity talent. This event is a great networking opportunity for those who are hoping to meet and converse about what it takes to succeed in the cyber industry. Organized by local cybersecurity training and services startup Cover6 Solutions, there will also be a series of talks focused on the best software tools being used today to help combat common threats and malicious hackers. 
Location: National Building Museum, 401 F Street NW, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Tuesday, October 06, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Price: Free 
The DC TechDay startup fair is returning Oct. 6 to the National Building Museum for its second year. Last year saw more than 150 D.C. tech startups and over 3,000 attendees, with even more expected this year. The event is deliberately very light on programming, aiming for more organic connections and deal-making between startups, investors and the community. Also: my colleague, Eric (eric@dcinno.com) will be in attendance. Give him a shout out if you want to talk about the local tech scene. Tips and comments welcomed. 
Location: GA DC, 1133 15th Street NW, 8th Floor, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Tuesday, October 6, from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. Price: Free 
Fifty one developers who just graduated from General Assembly’s immersive program will be in attendance ready to meet local tech cos. who are looking to hire. The event may be best described as a sort of “reverse career fair.” Come see student portfolios and to speak with them regarding full-time, contract and apprenticeship opportunities. Hiring managers, recruiters and HR personnel are encouraged to attend. Plus: food and refreshments will be provided. Wednesday, October 7 
Location: AOL, 22000 AOL Way, Dulles, V.A. Date/Time: Wednesday, October 7, begins at 8:00 AM Price: Free 
Come check out this monthly morning breakfast meet up, where startup founders and entrepreneurs will be pitching their ideas to the crowd. Start your day off right; with a coffee, bagel and casual networking event with other local tech enthusiast, business people while learning about some local cos. 
Location: GWU, Funger Hall, Room 103, 2201 G St. NW, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Wednesday, October 7, 6:30 p.m. to 9 p.m. Price: Free 
The Advisory Board data science director Harlan Harris will act as an instructor, teaching guests about how the “dplyr package for R provides a unified domain-specific language for tabular data.” Organizers from Data Community DC explain “in this talk, I will dive into the details of how high-level dplyr verbs get translated into SQL, and walk through tips and tricks, optimizations, and gotchas.” Thursday, October 8 
Location: Science Club, 1136 19th St Nw, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Thursday, October 8, 6:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m. Price: Free 
Looking for other android developers who are creating innovative products here in the District? Well, this is the official kick off of the new DC Android meetup, happening in downtown. Come out to meet other industry experts and to casually discuss what’s hot in Android development at a great local bar with a brew. Weekend, October 10-11 
Location: CustomInk, 2910 District Avenue , Fairfax, V.A. Date/Time: Saturday, October 10, from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. Price: Free 
It’s already fall, sweater weather is here and finding a nice space to code and meet others is more welcomed than ever. Come out to this casual co-working opportunity at CustomInk, where coffee and snacks will be provided to developers who would like to work together. Start your Saturday by being productive and by meeting other local tech enthusiast. 
Location: GW University, Funger Hall Room 108, 2121 I St NW, Washington, D.C. Date/Time: Saturday, October 10, from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Price: Free, limited tickets 
Data Community DC will be putting on a large scale event where the “State of Data Science Education” will be discussed by a panel of experts, industry experts and event participation. The goal is to “bring together educators, vocational programs and companies to discuss the state and future of data science,” according to the event organizer. All the tech news in D.C. you need to know.
